Saved Later'''''<br />(2000) | Next album = ''[[One Lie Fits All]]''<br />(2003) }} '''''Buy Now... Saved Later''''' is [[One Minute Silence]]'s second album, the follow-up to ''[[Available In All Colours]]''. It was released in 2000 on [[V2 Records]] and was dedicated "to the memory of [[Neville Anthony Lynch]]". In contrast to the [[Hip hop music|hip-hop]]-[[heavy metal music|metal]] tinge the first album had, ''Buy Now... Saved Later'' has a more traditional [[electric guitar|guitar]]-metal sound, produced by [[Colin Richardson]]. The [[cover art]] features a woman with devil horns, seemingly made of (or at least covered with) [[US dollar|dollar]] notes and holding a [[Bible]] in her right hand, and a bitten apple in the left (a reference to [[temptation]]). Behind her is a grey One Minute Silence logo which also appears on the [[Compact disc|CD]], on a black background. ==Track listing== # "Rise and Shine" - 3:16 # "1845" - 2:49 # "Holy Man" - 4:04 # "It's Just a Ride" - 3:37 # "Food for the Brain" - 3:50 # "[[Fish Out of Water (song)|Fish out of Water]]" - 4:23 # "Roof of the World" - 4:08 # "16 Stone Pig" - 3:29 # "210 Dog Years" - 3:47 # "If I Can Change" - 5:15 # "A Spoonful of Sugar" - 4:42 # "On Deaf Ears" - 4:10 # "A Day in the Light of" - 4:16 # "Words" - 5:55 # "14 Years" - 3:59 (Japan Bonus Track) # "I Feel Nothing" - 2:37 (Japan Bonus Track) The songs "''It's Just a Ride''" and "''If I Can Change''" were partly inspired by comedian [[Bill Hicks]].
